author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Salem Productivity Council will conduct an oratorical competition on ‘Ease of doing business for higher productivity and sustainable growth’ on February 11 at the council office near New Bus Stand.

A release from T.K. Velusamy, Chief Industrial Engineer of the council, said that as part of Productivity Week celebrations from February 12 to 18, several training programmes were conducted for entrepreneurs, employees, faculty members, students from technical and arts and science colleges. To mark the occasion, the council had planned to conduct oratorical contests both in Tamil and English for employees in industries and students in institutions. Each institution or industry could send two participants with bona fide certificate and seven minutes would be given for each participant. Competition would be held between 10 a.m. and 1 p.m. for employees and from 2 p.m. for students.

Interested should register themselves before February 10 through email or phone and for details, contact, C.S. Ramani Gopal, vice-president of the council, at 93456-96777. Phone: 0427-4037295, email:salemcouncil@gmail.com.
title: Oratorical competition for students, employees
